meanings.sent1: She enjoys embroidering flowers on her pillowcases.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother is embroidering a beautiful pattern on a handkerchief.
meanings.sent3: While embroidering a unicorn on her shirt, she accidentally sewed the horn upside down.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like embroidering a tapestry of kindness in my heart.
meanings.sent5: The artist was embroidering a masterpiece of colors and shapes onto the canvas.

meanings.definition: To add details or embellishments to something
meanings.sent1: He was embroidering his story with exaggerated details.
meanings.sent2: The chef was embroidering the cake with intricate sugar flowers.
meanings.sent3: She kept embroidering her excuses with more and more elaborate lies.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like embroidering a plain fabric with vibrant threads of humor.
meanings.sent5: The designer was embroidering the dress with sparkling beads and sequins.

meanings.definition: The act of sewing designs onto fabric
meanings.sent1: Her embroidery skills were evident in the beautiful embroidering on the dress.
meanings.sent2: The embroidering on the tablecloth added a touch of elegance to the dining table.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed fascinated by the embroidering on the curtains, trying to catch the threads.
meanings.sent4: The embroidering on the flag symbolized unity and strength.
meanings.sent5: The intricate embroidering on the jacket made it a unique piece of clothing.
